articles.title: Phase 1 trade deal stops bleeding, doesn't end U.S.-China dispute - U.S. Chamber
articles.description: The Phase 1 trade deal to be signed this week by China and the United States "stops the bleeding" but does not end the trade war, a senior U.S. Chamber of Commerce official said on Monday, warning that significant challenges remain.
articles.content:
BEIJING (Reuters) - The Phase 1 trade deal to be signed this week by China and the United States “stops the bleeding” but does not end the trade war, a senior U.S. Chamber of Commerce official said on Monday, warning that significant challenges remain.

articles.title: CANADA STOCKS-TSX futures flat ahead of Phase 1 Sino-U.S. trade deal
articles.description: Canada's main stock index futures stayed flat on Monday, ahead of the imminent signing of a preliminary Sino-U.S. trade deal.
articles.content:
Jan 13 (Reuters) - Canada’s main stock index futures stayed flat on Monday, ahead of the imminent signing of a preliminary Sino-U.S. trade deal.

articles.title: Libyan rivals, cajoled by Putin and Erdogan, to hold Moscow peace talks
articles.description: Libya's warring leaders were due to hold peace talks in Moscow on Monday with Russia and Turkey urging the rivals to sign a binding truce to end a nine-month-old war and pave the way for a settlement that would stabilize the North African country.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: India's December retail inflation accelerates to 7.35%
articles.description: India's retail inflation accelerated to 7.35% in December due to high food prices, government data showed on Monday.
articles.content:
NEW DELHI (Reuters) - India’s retail inflation accelerated to 7.35% in December due to high food prices, government data showed on Monday. 
December inflation was higher than 6.20% forecast in a Reuters poll of analysts.

articles.title: EU welcomes Libya ceasefire, says U.N. must lead reconciliation
articles.description: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen welcomed on Monday a ceasefire in Libya initiated by Turkey and Russia, but cautioned that the United Nations must lead the process of rebuilding the country.

articles.title: German North Sea wind capacity rose almost to 2020 target last year - TenneT
articles.description: Offshore wind power operators in the German North Sea raised generation capacity by 20.9% percent to 6,436 megawatts (MW) last year, grid company TenneT GmbH said on Monday, close to a government target for 2020 of 6,500 MW.
articles.content:
FRANKFURT (Reuters) - Offshore wind power operators in the German North Sea raised generation capacity by 20.9% percent to 6,436 megawatts (MW) last year, grid company TenneT GmbH said on Monday, close to a government target for 2020 of 6,500 MW.
